issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I created several Launch Configurations using "Create launch configuration like this" option from Instances Landing Page, and also "Create new Launch Configuration" dialog on Launch Configuration landing page. 
All launch configs use "default" security group.

Security group is not displayed for  launch configurations created via  "Create launch configuration like this". Screenshot included.
fields.summary: Security group is not displayed on Launch Configuration landing page.

comments.body: This is not fixed. The table doesn't have the security group filled. Also the expando doesn't expand for configs with security group set.
I went to test this just now (from testing) and don't see the problem. What browser were you using? Were you logged into euca or aws? Is this before or after you updated boto on your machine?
[~dkavanagh] it was QA machines and I used Chrome. I could see exception thrown in console. Logged-on euca.
[~dkavanagh] The issue manifests when the group "name" (not ID) is used in place of the group. This does not manifest with console, but reproducible when LC is created using euca2ools.

Still reproducible in:

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.2821.20131017gitf9c73545.el6

Still an issue as of:
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.1
Release     : 0.0.357.20131120git0cf384c9.el6

Security group not showing as shown in the original screenshots. 
Launched instance, selected instance -> more options -> create an autoscaling group like this option
I'll have to take this. Jerry's out of hours for us now.
I just ran against 10.111.1.16 and when I navigated to the LC landing page, the launch configs displayed (2 of them) and within a second or two, the security groups appeared.

This screenshot shows 2 launch configs created from a single running instance. The first group references a security group created through the UI and the second is using security group 'default'. The user is a account:test/ user:admin. 
In this case I've tried the following:
-waited until the session timed-out, no sec group. 
-waited 1 hour, re-logged in, no sec group
-waited several minutes, refreshed, waited several minutes, refreshed and so on. No sec. group. 
-Stopped the console process(s) updated the source code, restarted the console. Logged into the console, waited 10 minutes on the launch config tab. Still no sec group. 

I'm a Console newb, can someone verify if I am I using the correct code, ie 3.4.1 release, etc..? 
Thanks!
-Matt

commit 0bc53b8b59e8c4572b62d8aef3372ff4295e1ef0
Merge: 9bc67f2 3ca51f1
Author: kyolee310 <kyolee310@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 22 12:51:08 2013 -0800
Tested on OS X / FF 25. There is no s.group displayed when Launch Config is launched via "Create Launch Config like this". See attached movie.

The security group is now displayed when Launch Config is launched via "Create Launch Config like this".
[~alice] Love the movie! :)
